alert.note: Alert for Madera; Mariposa (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 11 at 1:59AM PST until March 11 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Madera and Mariposa. * WHEN...Until 500 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 159 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Yosemite South Entrance, Bootjack, Yosemite National, Yosemite Valley, Mariposa, Jerseydale, Wawona Campground, El Portal, Metcalf Gap, Wawona Vistor Center, Wawona, Badger Pass Ranger Station, Fish Camp, Ahwahnee, Mariposa Grove, Bridalveil Creek Campground, Batterson, Ostrander Lake, Yosemite Glacier Point and Catheys Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
